title: Pressure Cooker White Beans
description: Dead simple no-soak white beans in the Instant Pot. Rancho Gordo Alubia Blanca with just garlic, bay leaf, and salt — a blank canvas side dish.

directions.text: Salt beans, then add to the Instant Pot with water, crushed garlic, and bay leaf. Water should just cover the beans — don't overdo it.
Pressure cook on high for 20 minutes.
Natural pressure release. Open it when it's done — don't let it sit.

notes: No soak needed — straight from the bag to the pot.
Err on less water, but the pressure cooker has a minimum liquid requirement and beans absorb a lot — don't go under the minimum trying to cut back.

log.entry: First attempt. 23 mins on high with natural release — overcooked. Didn't open it right away after the pressure released because I was distracted, so it kept cooking in there. 1.5 quarts water for 225g beans was also too much. Dialing down to 20 mins and less water next time.
